skill.name: typescript-review
skill.description: Review TypeScript and JavaScript code changes for compliance with Metabase coding standards, style violations, and code quality issues. Use when reviewing pull requests or diffs containing TypeScript/JavaScript code.
skill.summary: Review TypeScript and JavaScript code changes for compliance with Metabase coding standards, style v...
skill.author: metabase

security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based code review skill that uses standard Read, Grep, Bash, and Glob tools. It references only legitimate project build commands (yarn lint/prettier/test/type-check) for code analysis. Static findings are false positives: URL metadata flagged as network risk, backtick-wrapped documentation flagged as shell execution, and text patterns incorrectly flagged as cryptographic issues. Behavior matches stated purpose exactly.

content.value_statement: Manual code reviews are time-consuming and inconsistent. This skill automates code review by checking TypeScript and JavaScript changes against project standards, identifying style violations, type errors, and quality issues automatically.
actual_capabilities: Reviews TypeScript and JavaScript code for coding standards compliance
Checks for style violations using ESLint and Prettier
Validates JSDoc comments for completeness and accuracy
Ensures type safety and proper TypeScript usage
Reviews React components for best practices
Runs type checking and linting commands on the codebase
limitations: Does not modify code automatically - only provides review feedback
Requires access to project build tools (yarn, node_modules)
Limited to TypeScript and JavaScript file types

use_cases.title: Review JavaScript pull requests
use_cases.description: Review JS and TS PRs for code quality, style consistency, and React best practices before merging.

use_cases.title: Enforce coding standards
use_cases.description: Maintain consistent code style across the codebase by automating standard compliance checks.

use_cases.title: Identify code quality issues
use_cases.description: Catch type safety issues, missing documentation, and React anti-patterns before they reach production.

prompt_templates.title: General TypeScript Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the typescript-review skill to review the TypeScript changes in this diff. Focus on coding standards, type safety, and best practices.

prompt_templates.title: JSDoc Compliance Check
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the typescript-review skill to review the JSDoc comments in the changed files. Ensure all public APIs have complete documentation.

prompt_templates.title: React Component Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the typescript-review skill to review the React component changes. Check for proper hooks usage, component structure, and performance patterns.

prompt_templates.title: Full Code Quality Audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the typescript-review skill to perform a comprehensive code review of all changes. Include linting, type checking, and code quality recommendations.

best_practices: Run linting and type checking before requesting reviews to reduce friction
Provide specific context about the changes when prompting the skill
Combine automated reviews with human judgment for critical changes
anti_patterns: Requesting reviews without running linting tools first
Accepting all suggestions without understanding the reasoning
Skipping manual review for security-critical changes

faq.question: What AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Each platform handles skill execution slightly differently.

faq.question: How large can the codebase be?
faq.answer: The skill can review files of any size, but very large diffs may be split into multiple review passes for better accuracy.

faq.question: Does this integrate with Git?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill works with Git changes. You can point it to diffs, specific files, or run it in CI pipelines.

faq.question: Is my code data safe?
faq.answer: Code is processed locally within your environment. No code is sent to external services beyond your AI provider.

faq.question: Why are some issues missed?
faq.answer: The skill relies on ESLint, Prettier, and TypeScript compiler. Run these tools directly for complete coverage.

faq.question: Can I run multiple reviews?
faq.answer: Yes, there is no limit on the number of reviews you can run. Each review is independent.
